channel.title: Lounge - Axoloti Community
channel.description:
Topics in the 'Lounge' category This category is for discussions that are related to Axoloti generally but are not specifically about Axoloti.
(please ensure it has some relevance to Axoloti, rather than general discussion)

item.title: Blixa song Axolotl
item.dc:creator: @joaogatao joaogatao
item.description:
@joaogatao wrote:

Ich bin ein kleines Axolotl
Nicht spezialisiert
Mein Habitat, ganz überall
Ist wie es mir pläsiert

Ich bin ein lächelndes Axolotl
Zu nichts prädestiniert
Die Welt, mein Territorium
Ist si für mich kreiert

Ich, das Axolotl, will nicht werden
Was ich werden sollte
Ich will nicht werden
Was ich werden könnte
Ich will werden, werden, werden
Was ich werden will – totipotent

Song by Blixa Bargeld & Teho Teardo
Axoloti can be what it wants to be

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic

item.title: An instrument that non-musicians can play with?
item.dc:creator: @KelvinT KelvinT
item.description:
@KelvinT wrote:

I've been thinking about getting my friends into synths & music hardware, and I'm trying to come up with something that even someone with no experience on music making would have so much fun tweaking and making sounds from it.

This might not be a good place to ask (since a lot of us have some experience with sound design or synth tweaking), but what would a non-producer or non-musician want to play with?

Obviously I'm going to turn some of the ideas into an Axoloti patch.

Posts: 7

Participants: 7

Read full topic
item.source: An instrument that non-musicians can play with?

item.title: OpenDeck board and fw
item.dc:creator: @trimardius
item.description:
@trimardius wrote:

Hi,
this topic to express my enthusiasm for this one man project.
I was looking for a way to control my next axoloti project with a lot of controls. I wanted them to be nrpn resolution since I am quite hooked to the resolution of analog inputs on axo. And although I have done multiplexing directly on axo (with the help of great objects from great coders on the forum) this time I wanted to safe my axo resources for actual synthesis stuff... (as a side not I must say muxing does not take that much of resources but still...)

Not being a coder myself I was looking for a 'user friendly' way. I stumbled on this project that looked very promising:

github.com

paradajz/OpenDeck

Software and hardware platform for simpler building of MIDI controllers. - paradajz/OpenDeck


Have a look at the features and you'll see what I mean:
github.com

paradajz/OpenDeck

Software and hardware platform for simpler building of MIDI controllers. - paradajz/OpenDeck


The settings are made via a WebInterface:

I ran a short test with 2x 4051 multiplexer (and @DrJustice 's object drj/midi/nrpn_rx_f) on a Blackpill STM32F11CE (damn cheap) and it is running great. I was up and running in an hour (apart from the hours working myself into github, flashing etc... I am totally new to arduino-alike stuff...)
I ordered a bunch of 4067's and would like to run a test with 4 of them, hoping not to run into trouble traffic wise...)
If all goes well I'll end up with a 64pot nprn controller...

Anyway, thumbs up for this guys project!

Posts: 4

Participants: 2

Read full topic

item.title: [sold] Selling two (one and a half?) Axoloti (Berlin)
item.dc:creator: @srodillof sebastian
item.description:
@srodillof wrote:

[edit: both boards have been SOLD]

Hello! I bought 2 Axos some years ago for a university project, and I haven't used them since, so it would be nice if someone else gave them love.

20210109_201626.jpg4032x2268 2.63 MB
20210109_201629.jpg1603x2851 1.52 MB
20210109_201614.jpg1603x2851 1.81 MB
20210109_201643.jpg1603x2851 1.58 MB

One of them is slightly modified - only added some contact pins, as far as I can tell.
The second Axo had been butchered a little bit. I took off some of the connectors because I wasn't using them and I had to fit them into a small enclosure. It also has a bridge to connect both Axoloti together, but that can easily be removed.

We can talk details privately. Haven't decided a price yet because honestly I don't care, but I would like them to find a new loving parent.

Posts: 2

Participants: 2

Read full topic
item.source: [sold] Selling two (one and a half?) Axoloti (Berlin)

item.title: Side project - "Betweener" - a cheap teensy-based MIDI-CV conversion and control tool
item.dc:creator: @kat
item.description:
@kat wrote:

Hey all,

I've been meaning to post this here forever, but I guess I really really suck as a saleslady... I worked with some friends/colleagues here in Chicago a couple of years ago to make an affordable Teensy-based MIDI/CV converter and flexible experimental control platform (Eurorack compatible). It isn't profoundly unique, nor cutting-edge, but we've found that it is a very handy little device for placing between other parts of an experimental soundmaking system. I really like using it with Axoloti to let Axoloti-based signals control an analog synth. The Betweener was built with a pedagogical context in mind... I wrote a simple support library for it which is very heavily commented, for a student audience.

All info is open source of course but there are a few kits available too, and all the links are in the page shared below.

Thought I should finally post this...for a summer when maybe a lot of people are going to be stuck in their houses more than usual, needing projects?

https://josephmkramer.com/betweener

Posts: 2

Participants: 2

Read full topic
item.source: Side project - "Betweener" - a cheap teensy-based MIDI-CV conversion and control tool

item.title: Korg Nu:Tekt NTS-1
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

These were announced last year, but they're finally becoming available.

In some ways, similar to Axoloti (STM32F4 + DAC). It's user programmable (for programmers, anyway), but comes fully set up as a digital monosynth with FX.

Oscillators created for NTS-1 will run on Prologue and Minilogue.

I couldn't resist, mine should arrive on Friday.

Participants: 4

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone experience with traveling by airplane with an Axoloti box?
item.dc:creator: @trimardius
item.description:
@trimardius wrote:

Hi,
This may sound as a strange and off topic question...
Sunday I'll be leaving for Japan by airplane. I would like to take my Axoloti box (Axoloti built in an old box with lots of buttons etc on, and a lot of spaghetti wires inside.) I was wondering if anyone had experience with reactions of security checks and border crossing checks.
I can imagine that some paranoia official will doubt about the purpose of the box and mistakenly see it for a hostile device. It would be painful and a sad day to see my beloved disappear in a trash bin...

Is there anyone experienced?
have a nice day!

Posts: 5

Participants: 4

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone experience with traveling by airplane with an Axoloti box?

item.title: Ordered a second one
item.dc:creator: @ivofx Ivo Grigull
item.description:
@ivofx wrote:

Apologies in advance. I only want to express my gratitude and out myself as a fan-boy.
I think the Axoloti is the best invention since sliced bread. Because a lot of expensive hardware devices are close to being great but often slightly miss the mark and you can't do anything about it.

Whereas the Axoloti is completely customizable and has such a great way of building patches. I love the combination of visual/graph based editing together with being able to write C++ code. I like the choice of C++ over adding some high-level language, I guess it's common sense because of the execution speed.

It let's me create way more complex sequencers, I can glue existing Midi devices by making it process midi data in interesting ways. It's simply more bang for the buck if you are willing put some some work into it.

Thanks to all the providers of patches and objects, they are immensely useful.

At this point I am only using existing midi-controllers but I am looking forward to building my own.

By the way, are there any ready-made PCBs available for building a sequencer?
I am also looking for instructions on connecting/programming small screens (I got an 128x64 pixel OLED available for example)

Posts: 2

Participants: 2

Read full topic

item.title: Proce55ing + Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @joaogatao joaogatao
item.description:
@joaogatao wrote:

In fact it's just using the Axoloti's midi out, but fun to add a visual part. Or to use Processing as XY-controller, etc.
Processing uses the MidiBus library (install from Sketch -> Import Library... -> Add Library... -> 'The MidiBus')

A simple etch-a-sketch type implementation using 2 pots on the Axoloti, sent over midi cc, and receiving midi thru from Processing.

github.com

joaogatao/axoloti

Some patches for axoloti (w/ EWI). Contribute to joaogatao/axoloti development by creating an account on GitHub.

... but now having this problem

Cannot connect due to firmware issues but firmware flashing doesn't seem to do anything Helpdesk
Hello, I am having issues connecting to my axoloti core from the desktop program. I connect to the axoloti core and I get the following errors in the log: connected invalid CPU serial number, invalid protocol?, update firmware Can't obtain signature, upgrade firmware? Ping: WaitSync Timeout, disconnecting now Disconnect request Ping: WaitSync Timeout, disconnecting now Ping: WaitSync Timeout, disconnecting now However, when I go to flash the firmware, I only have the option to flash (rescu…

item.title: Exploring creating a curriculum for school with Axolotl?
item.dc:creator: @twinfin
item.description:
@twinfin wrote:

Hi there,

I am an axoloti newbie, longtime synth tweaker, and a part time teacher.

I am exploring using the axoloti as a platform to introduce concepts of sound design, dsp, synthesis, programing logic, product design, at my sons school (middle school - high school) ...

Just wondering if any of you have done something like this and might be able to share your experience.

Thank you.
